DataElement.preferredName: Alcohol History 3 Beverage Per Day Consumption Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Yes/No indicator to signify a history of alcohol use of at least 3 alcoholic drinks per day.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Alcohol Abuse History 3 Beverage Per Day Consumption
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The aggregate of past events; the continuum of events occurring in succession leading from the past to the present; a record or narrative description of past events._The use of alcoholic beverages to excess, either on individual occasions ("binge drinking") or as a regular practice._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::3_A drink, including beer, wine or liquor, that is made by fermentation of raw materials. An alcoholic beverage contains ethanol (alcohol) as the active ingredient._A frequency rate of occurrences of something within a period of time equal to twenty-four hours._The bodily process of taking in and using up something, especially the eating or drinking of something.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The use of alcoholic beverages to excess, either on individual occasions ("binge drinking") or as a regular practice.:The aggregate of past events; the continuum of events occurring in succession leading from the past to the present; a record or narrative description of past events.

Concepts.definition: The use of alcoholic beverages to excess, either on individual occasions ("binge drinking") or as a regular practice.
The aggregate of past events; the continuum of events occurring in succession leading from the past to the present; a record or narrative description of past events.

Property.preferredName: Integer::3 Alcoholic Beverage Per Day Consumption
Property.preferredDefinition: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::3:A drink, including beer, wine or liquor, that is made by fermentation of raw materials. An alcoholic beverage contains ethanol (alcohol) as the active ingredient.:A frequency rate of occurrences of something within a period of time equal to twenty-four hours.:The bodily process of taking in and using up something, especially the eating or drinking of something.

Concepts.definition: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
A drink, including beer, wine or liquor, that is made by fermentation of raw materials. An alcoholic beverage contains ethanol (alcohol) as the active ingredient.
A frequency rate of occurrences of something within a period of time equal to twenty-four hours.
The bodily process of taking in and using up something, especially the eating or drinking of something.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Observations and activities relating to behavior, such as smoking and ETOH use.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator of Yes or No to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ReferenceDocuments.name: History of excessive alcohol
ReferenceDocuments.description: History of excessive alcohol abuse, defined by a habitual intake of more than three drinks daily
